title: timeFactors
content: Factors for converting between time units.

title: Severity
content: Defines the possible severity levels for an entity

title: generateRandomUUID
content: Helper function to generate a random UUID.

title: DurationPipe
content: Convert duration from one unit to another or generate a human-readable duration breakdown.

title: InitialsPipe
content: Formats initials from given user based on their information: If no fistName nor lastName was provided, method will returns email's first letter. Otherwise, will return the first letters of the firstName and lastName. If none of these information are provided, it will return a question mark.

title: TrustHtmlPipe
content: Formats given html content and makes it "safe" using DomSanitizer. This pipe must be used with controlled content only (should be parsed and escaped)

title: TrustUrlPipe
content: Formats given url and makes it "safe" using DomSanitizer. This pipe must be used with controlled content only (should be parsed and escaped to prevent XSS attacks)

title: TruncateTextPipe
content: Truncate text to a specified length and add ellipsis at the end. Uses the html-ellipsis package to render HTML tags correctly. (bold, italic, etc.). This pipe is meant to be used inside a InnerHTML binding. Check out usage in the demo.

title: WeightPipe
content: Convert weight from one unit to another.

title: Toast
content: Defines toast instance. It could be used to inform the user about the result of the action or to show some error messages.

title: ToastOptions
content: Options available when creating toast.

title: NotificationCenterComponent
content: Simple container for global notification Will display all notification emitted from NotificationService.notifications signal

title: CardComponent
content: Simple component to render a card with title, optionally subtitle or footer. The footer can be passed as a template with the name cardFooter. (See example)

title: clean
content: Clean the given object by removing all nullish values. (empty object, string and array.)

title: dashToCamelCase
content: This function uses a regular expression to convert dash-case string to camelCase.

title: capitalize
content: Capitalize given string. (Make the first letter uppercase.)

title: addOrReplace
content: Adds or replaces an object in an array based on a property. If the object is not found, it will be added to the array. If the object is found, it will be replaced by the new object.

title: isBoolean
content: Checks if given property is a boolean type

title: Notification
content: Defines notification instance.

title: isString
content: Checks if given property is a string type

title: SincePipe
content: Convert a timestamp to a human-readable string representing the time since the timestamp. Also works with future dates.

title: ButtonAppearance
content: Appearance of the button.

title: ButtonAppearance
content: basic - No background color, Selector color is applied to text color. Ripple effect on hover.flat - Default button appearance. Selector color is applied to background. Ripple effect on hover.stroked - Button with border. Selector color is applied to border color. Ripple effect on hover.icon - Button with icon only. Spacing are squared. Ripple effect on hover.icon-stroked - Button with icon only and border. Spacing are squared. Ripple effect on hover.fab - Floating action button. Circular button with icon only. Ripple effect on hover.

title: CanDeactivateGuard
content: Checks if component allows user to be redirect to an another route.

title: CanDeactivateGuard
content: Must be called in angular routes with canDeactivate property.Must be associated with Component that contains a canDeactivate() method

title: CanDeactivateGuard
content: This way, components can defines some logic to prevent user from leaving route for specific reason. For example, if user has unsaved changes, it can ask user to confirm if he wants to leave the page. If user confirms, it will return true and user will be redirected to the new route. Otherwise, it will return false and user will stay on the current route.

title: PlatformService
content: Provides methods and property to keep track of current device information. (OS, screen size, etc.)

title: PlatformService
content: When application init, this service process the following:

title: PlatformService
content: Watch for the current size {@link PlatformBreakpointName} and update {@currentSize} value whenever viewport size changes.

title: PlatformService
content: name of the current size based on device screen width (default is unset)

title: PlatformService
content: Checks if current browser size (width) is bigger or equal to the size given.

title: PlatformService
content: Checks if current browser size (width) is bigger than the size given.

title: PlatformService
content: Checks if platform is a mobile (android or ios)

title: PlatformService
content: Checks if currentSize if smaller or equal to 'sm' size

title: PlatformService
content: Checks if current browser size (width) is smaller or equal to the size given.

title: PlatformService
content: Checks if current browser size (width) is smaller than the size given.

title: PlatformService
content: Checks viewport and returns desired size. For example, if device is a mobile, this method will return {mobileSize} Note: If called directly in component template: [class]="responsive(...)", value will update automatically !

title: Welcome
content: Tired of having to fight with frameworks behavior ? Want to regain control of your UI without having to overrides all components. This project help you create your own component without any extras dependencies. Ok, actually you are going to need 3:

title: Welcome
content: Angular (can't do much without it)Tailwind (helps simplify harmonious UI)Angular cdk (a lot of handful tools there)

title: Welcome
content: If you are ok with using thoses dependencies, this project is made for you ! This is not a framework, nor a cdk, but simply a collection of components following best practices in angular web development.

title: Welcome
content: This repository was created as a model for creating actual application. Feel free to use take any components you want üôå

title: Welcome
content: If you want to use components in this repository, make sure you have thoses dependencies with compatibles versions.

title: Welcome
content: Dependency

title: Welcome
content: version

title: Welcome
content: @angular/core

title: Welcome
content: rxjs

title: Welcome
content: typescript

title: Welcome
content: tailwind

title: Welcome
content: Those dependencies were used to create this repository but are not mandatory for yours.

title: Welcome
content: Dependency

title: Welcome
content: version

title: Welcome
content: eslint

title: Welcome
content: ngdoc

title: Welcome
content: More dependencies can be found inside package.json.

title: Welcome
content: To discover what's inside this repository, i recommend going to the documentation page. From there, look for the sidebar which all components, services, pipes, and guides (soon).

title: Welcome
content: All classes are also referenced on the API documentation

title: Welcome
content: This project contains multiple scripts. Remember to first run npm i in order to load required dependencies. Then you can run any of the scripts below:

title: Welcome
content: Script

title: Welcome
content: Description

title: Welcome
content: npm run start

title: Welcome
content: Serves application locally to

title: Welcome

title: Welcome

title: Welcome
content: Builds application in production mode to

title: Welcome
content: dist/ngx-lib/browser

title: Welcome
content: npm run watch

title: Welcome
content: Builds application in development mode and watch for file change

title: Welcome
content: npm run lint

title: Welcome
content: Lint repository with eslint & prettier.

title: Welcome
content: A complete changelog can be found in dedicated markdown. Which resume current progress. You can also found what is in the current development inside TODO markdown.
